alert.note: Alert for Wyoming (Pennsylvania) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Binghamton (South Central New York and Northeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 09 at 9:29AM EDT by NWS Binghamton
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of Wyoming County through 1000 AM EDT... At 929 AM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Evans Falls, or 7 miles southwest of Tunkhannock, moving east at 20 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Falls, Vernon, Tunkhannock, Noxen, Mehoopany, Meshoppen, Forkston, Kasson Brook, Osterhout and Evans Falls. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
